byline.original: By OTTO D. TOLISCHUS Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

snippet: BERLIN, Dec. 31--With the shadow of war again darkening their New Year's celebration for the fifth time within a generation, the German people go into 1940 with grave faces and mingled feelings ranging from grim determination to gnawing fear, but ...

headline.main: Reich Looks to New Air Weapons, Holding Deadlock Is Temporary; Pursuit Ships Now Building Can Accompany Bombers on Raiding Flights--Machine Cannon Firing Explosive Shells a Factor

lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Dec. 31--With the shadow of war again darkening their New Year's celebration for the fifth time within a generation, the German people go into 1940 with grave faces and mingled feelings ranging from grim determination to gnawing fear, but little merriment.
